timeline: 5-6 months after Chapter 13, covering a 5-month population boom period
location: Level 8/9 checkpoint, Buildings across multiple sectors, Mother Sera's apartment, Jax's office

knows: 4,500 Gammas have moved from Level 8 to Level 9 in 5 months
Started as desperate, became hopeful, now everyone coming
People choosing undercity Free Level over legal housing
Bought 12 more buildings for 1.2 billion credits
Now has ~19 total buildings, ~3,500 residents (stopped counting individuals)
90 staff members employed
Labor songs spreading organically through community
Station Authority has noticed - formal inquiry issued
Must appear before Level Management Board within 30 days
Charges: unauthorized development, tax evasion, public health risk, security concerns
They're really concerned about concentrated Gamma population
Hearing scheduled for 14:00 at Level 5 Administrative Complex
Has temporary pass to reach Level 5 (irony noted)
Mother Sera says he's defending the idea that Gammas deserve dignity
4,000+ people can't be disappeared easily
Culture and community are spreading as fast as hope
Jax Varro.emotional_state: Determined, aware of danger, committed to fighting, ready to defend publicly
Jax Varro.location: Office at Building 47, preparing for hearing
Jax Varro.physical_state: Working until dawn, running on purpose
Jax Varro.wealth: Spent another 1.2 billion (total ~2.2 billion spent), still has Earth currency to sell
Jax Varro.decision: Will fight the hearing, will publicly defend Gamma humanity

knows: 400 new arrivals per week at peak
People choosing Free Level over legal housing
Station Authority has issued formal inquiry
Hearing is in 12 hours (narrative present)
They're going with Jax as backup
Finn.emotional_state: Concerned, supportive, ready to stand with Jax
Finn.role: Going to hearing as backup with Zara

knows: Station Authority noticed and is moving against Free Level
Jax is willing to fight
Once he defends Gamma humanity publicly, he'll be marked
4,000 people can't be easily disappeared
This is about stopping Gammas from organizing, not about regulations
Mother Sera.emotional_state: Supportive, wise, preparing Jax for consequences
Mother Sera.philosophy: 'They can't disappear us all' and 'sing so loud they can't ignore us'

knows: 4,500 new arrivals in 5 months
Waiting list now at 3,000
Current capacity: ~750-950 residents across 165 units plus overcrowding
Set up intake processing system at checkpoint
10 more buildings would cost 1 billion, increase operating costs to 60 million/month
At current growth: 3-4 years until money runs out
Going to hearing as backup
Zara.role: Administrator, attendance at hearing for professional appearance

revealed_to_reader: Phenomenon started 3 weeks before chapter, then accelerated
First trickle: desperate (lost jobs, can't afford rent, injured, sick)
Then hopeful, then everyone
Quote: 'Down there we're people. Up here we're just livestock that happens to be useful'
Scanners track Gamma movement from Level 8 to 9 (downward movement unusual)
Zara set up checkpoint processing: intake forms, housing assignments, orientation
63 arrivals first day, 400 by end of first week
4,500 total over 5 months
Emergency staff meeting called
Staff now includes 90 people (was 30, now 60 more hired)
12 new buildings bought and renovated for 1.2 billion
Sectors expanded to: 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 11
Three more medical clinics opened
100 patients per day across all clinics
Timeline: 4 months of expansion after initial influx week
Month 2: 2,000 residents. Month 3: 3,500 residents. Month 4: stopped counting individuals, count families instead
Labor songs spreading organically - children learning and teaching each other
Songs heard everywhere: hallways, clinics, common areas
Official Notice from Station Authority, Office of Level Management
30-day deadline to appear before Level Management Board
Concerns listed: building codes, tax evasion, public health, security (concentrated Gamma population)
Jax spent 2 weeks preparing documentation
Documentation includes: property purchases, inspection reports, financial records, medical statistics (40% reduction in preventable deaths), employment records (90 staff), resident testimonials
Hearing set for 14:00 at Level 5 Administrative Complex
Jax issued temporary pass to reach Level 5
Jax, Finn, and Zara will attend together
Final resident count: ~3,500-4,500 (text varies between 'thirty-five hundred' and 'four thousand')

planted.element: Labor songs spreading organically through children
planted.significance: Cultural weapon becoming part of daily life

planted.element: Station Authority formal inquiry and hearing
planted.significance: Sets up next chapter where authorities send Elara to investigate

planted.element: Jax will be 'marked' after public defense of Gamma humanity

planted.significance: Concrete evidence of Free Level's impact

planted.element: Level 5 Administrative Complex as authority location
Temporary pass irony - still can't go to Level 5 without permission
planted.significance: Reminder of his genetic imprisonment despite influence

active_tensions: Station Authority wanting to shut down concentrated Gamma population
Growth rate burning through money in 3-4 years
Jax's commitment to fight vs. real possibility of losing
Whether Jax will be marked/targeted after public testimony
Question of how to sustain this growth
world_changes: Total Free Level buildings: 19 (7 from Ch12 + 12 new)
Total residents: 3,500-4,500 (sources vary, use 4,000 as approximate)
Operating costs: 60 million per month minimum
Labor songs are now part of Free Level culture
Gammas choosing to move from legal Level 8 housing to undercity
Station Authority has formally noticed and issued inquiry
Hearing scheduled for 14:00, Level 5 Administrative Complex
Three more medical clinics opened (total now 5-6)
Culture is spreading as fast as hope
continuity_notes: Hearing is set for next day from narrative present
Operating costs from 32 million/month (Ch12) to 60 million/month (Ch14)
Jax has never been to Level 5 before
Next chapter (15) is when Elara arrives - this hearing likely triggers her investigation
Labor songs notebook from Ch13 is being used - songs spreading
